noun.description: Movement to and fro or around something, especially that of fluid in a closed system.
examples: an extra pump for good water circulation

noun.description: The public availability or knowledge of something.
examples: his music has achieved wide circulation

phrases: there is a huge volume of video material in circulation
There are at any moment in Silicon Valley about 10,000 business plans in circulation, looking for money.
The memory cell remains in circulation, ready to respond to reintroduction of the antigen.
At present, there are over 190 copies of the video in circulation.
Tickets are now in circulation and are available from any committee member.
origin: Late Middle English (denoting continuous distillation of a liquid): from Latin circulatio(n-), from the verb circulare (see circulate).
